image.altText: An elderly man wearing a black beanie looks at a rain gauge

props.synopsis: Farmers were able to achieve a good harvest over summer because of sub-soil moisture, but a second year of extremely low rainfall has them fretting.

title.children: Worry as SA drought smashes low-rainfall records in farming areas

image.altText: southern right whale breaching out of water.

props.synopsis: Whale tourism operator Rod Keogh fears his business of 17 years may not survive the introduction of new whale nursery areas in SA.

title.children: Proposal to keep whale-watching vessels further back concerns operators

image.altText: A black and brown puppy held by a boy

props.synopsis: Downpours during the Australian Kelpie Muster bring smiles, not scowls, to a drought-stricken town in western Victoria.

title.children: Tails wag at kelpie muster as rain drenches town ravaged by drought

image.altText: Artist Jungle looks into the camera smiling, he wears glasses and a dress hat and jacket both covered in splotches of paint.

props.synopsis: Jungle could once paint around 100 works in one sitting. Today he might be a little slower, but his joyful expression on canvas hasn't diminished a bit.

title.children: Why walking through this artist's home is an unforgettable experience

image.altText: An Australian swimmer arches her back as she dives into the water in a backstroke race.

props.synopsis: Kaylee McKeown beat rival Mollie O'Callaghan in the race of the night at the Australian Swimming Trials, but she acknowledges she is still not at her best after struggling since the Paris Olympics.

title.children: McKeown survives DQ and a dark place to qualify for world titles

image.altText: A close up shot of a man's hand holding a rain gauge showing almost 24mm of rain

props.synopsis: Much-needed rain has soaked parched land across parts of South Australia but farmers say more is required to break the drought.

title.children: Rain a 'celebration' but not a drought-breaker for SA farmers

image.altText: Three children on a large dinosaur statue.

props.synopsis: An unexpected online auction buy lands an 8-metre-long, 3m-high dinosaur in a Milang front yard, bringing smiles and new visitors to the struggling town.

title.children: How an impulse purchase gone wrong became town's unofficial mascot

image.altText: Baby twins, Max (left) and Blake (right) sit on their parents's laps wearing matching Bluey jumpers

props.synopsis: Researchers in Adelaide are looking to expand newborn heel-prick screening to help identify up to 600 additional genetic conditions early.

title.children: Up to 1,000 families to take part in newborn heel-prick screening research

image.altText: The ASX boards in Sydney

props.synopsis: Australian shares are making gains as traders wait for news from the latest round of US-China trade talks, which will recommence overnight. Monash IVF shares plunge on news of another embryo bungle. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar on the rise as ASX 200 on track for record close

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Prime Minister announces productivity round table
Jenny Wilkinson to be Australia's first female Treasury secretary
ASX up 0.8% on track for record close

image.altText: Japanese navy boss stands in front of frigate and smiles

props.synopsis: The Mogami-class frigate's arrival in Darwin comes as Japan competes with Germany to secure a $10 billion Australian defence contract.

title.children: Mogami-class frigate docks in Darwin as Japan pushes for $10bn contract

image.altText: REA logo outside their office is of a red and white arrow going up

props.synopsis: It can cost thousands to list a property online for sale. The competition regulator has stepped in after years of complaints that REA Group is using its dominant position to the detriment of home sellers and real estate agents.

title.children: 'Complete market saturation': Real estate listings giant faces probe

image.altText: A landscape shot of an alpine environment blanketed in snow.

props.synopsis: A search is underway for a man believed to be missing in Tasmania's Cradle Mountain region since Sunday.

title.children: Man missing at Cradle Mountain since Sunday

image.altText: Michelle O'Byrne gestures in front of the speaker's chair in Tasmania's parliament.

props.synopsis: Speaker and long-serving Labor MP Michelle O'Byrne announces she will retire from politics at the next election, which is expected to be called later today.

title.children: Tasmanian speaker delivers parting shot at own party as she prepares to calls it quits

image.altText: A Black man in a yellow shirt bends over a water fountain and splashes his head with water.

props.synopsis: Early reports indicate this year's death toll at the Hajj pilgrimage is dramatically lower than last year's, but climate change still presents a major risk.

title.children: Death toll drops at Mecca, although annual pilgrimage presents 'cocktail of risks'

image.altText: greta thunberg wearing a life jacket while being detained by israel police

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the crew of the Madleen say the activists have been wrongfully detained by Israeli authorities, who intercepted the ship trying to take aid to the war-ravaged strip.

title.children: Israel accused of breaching law by storming Greta Thunberg aid ship

image.altText: An elderly, bearded man wearing an animal-fur hat on his head.

props.synopsis: Amid an extinction crisis, some amateur conservationists are taking matters into their own hands, releasing threatened animals on their properties. It's skirting rules and worrying scientists.

title.children: Unapproved rewilding stirs debate over ethics and animal welfare

image.altText: A man standing and speaking, while a young boy next to him picks his nose, and another man sits behind a desk

props.synopsis: Australia is likely to be a major casualty as the White House launches a new weapon in its war against the Western alliance.

title.children: Albanese should forget Trump's tariff war and prepare for a tax assault

image.altText: Saudi Arabia players celebrate

props.synopsis: The Socceroos are just a solid performance from reaching their sixth FIFA World Cup finals in a row, but must remain focused against Saudi Arabia in Jeddah. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: What the Socceroos need to qualify for the World Cup

image.altText: A graphic of a de-identified boy sitting down with his hands over his face, with a dark generic background.

props.synopsis: A whistleblower says a 12-year-old boy with disabilities alleged to be the victim of indecent treatment in Cairns watch house has been flown to Brisbane and placed in housing "similar to a correctional facility".

title.children: 12yo boy put in house similar to 'correctional facility', whistleblower claims

image.altText: A mum with a newborn baby in hospital

props.synopsis: Medical groups and a national charity add to calls from parents to bolster a paediatric cardiology service in Far North Queensland.

title.children: Cairns's only paediatric cardiologist under 'intense pressure'

image.altText: Crowds inside the airport.

props.synopsis: A Qantas flight (QF2) flying from London to Singapore has been forced to make an urgent landing in Azerbaijan, after a passenger suffered a life-threatening cardiac emergency mid-flight.

title.children: Aussies to depart Azerbaijan after Qantas flight's sudden diversion

image.altText: Two men smiling in suits with red umbrellas and red Labor signs.

props.synopsis: The Albanese government is facing pressure from its backbench to move quickly on sweeping changes to environment laws after a contentious gas project was granted provisional approval.

title.children: Albanese government faces pressure from within over coal and gas approvals

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Penny Wong

props.synopsis: Generation X is overwhelmingly in charge of government and increasingly holding the wealth.

title.children: Australia's political class is full of gen Xers who could address inequality

image.altText: Four-wheel drives on a beach bathed in yellow light as the sun sets over the water.

props.synopsis: As the redevelopment of Cable Beach enters its second year, Broome business owners and residents say access restrictions to the tourist drawcard are damaging their livelihoods and way of life.

title.children: Restricted 4WD access at famous WA beach leaves locals fuming

image.altText: a woman speaking to the media outdoors

props.synopsis: Prue Car says she is taking personal leave for "an undetermined period of time" after being diagnosed with breast cancer.

title.children: 'I'm determined to beat this': NSW deputy premier has breast cancer

image.altText: An older man with white hair and glasses chops a chocolate croissant, wearing an apron that reads "Men's Kitchen".

props.synopsis: The Men's Kitchen is changing the lives of men over 60, many of whom are recently widowed or caring for partners who can no longer cook, teaching kitchen skills and offering social connection.

title.children: 'I was the apprentice': Dennis is learning to cook after his wife's death

image.altText: Stickers advertising Afterpay and Zip on the window of a clothing store.

props.synopsis: Consumer protections that apply to credit products such as hardship requests will now apply to BNPL providers such as Afterpay and Zip.

title.children: As the US reacts to burrito-now, pay later, Australia regulates BNPL

image.altText: A flowering tobacco plant in a field.

props.synopsis: Authorities seize a 20-tonne crop of mature tobacco being grown on 2.4 hectares, an area equivalent to more than 450 tennis courts, in Victoria's north.

title.children: Illicit tobacco crop worth $4.4m discovered near Shepparton after tip-off

image.altText: A bucket of ripe Tasmanian blueberries freshly picked

props.synopsis: Eye-watering blueberry prices could stay higher for longer this year due to seasonal shortages and crop damage caused by torrential rain in northern New South Wales.

title.children: Flooded growers ask for patience as blueberry prices near $10 a punnet

image.altText: A family stands next to a dam with some water in it on a farm.

props.synopsis: Victorian farmers breathed a sigh of relief across the weekend as much-needed rain fell across the state.

title.children: 'Grinning our heads off': Farmers ecstatic after much-needed rains

image.altText: A 3D graphic of a large long-necked sauropod with yellowish skin standing on mud next to pine-like trees.

props.synopsis: The first reported fossilised stomach contents from a sauropod, belonging to a Diamantinasaurus that lived 95 million years ago, has confirmed a long-held theory of herbivorous behaviour.

title.children: Gut fossil from Aussie dinosaur 'Judy' first to show what sauropods ate

image.altText: A man wearing a beige suit, waistcoat and striped tie, with a shadow cast on a bright yellow and orange background

props.synopsis: Sly Stone, the legendary bandleader of Sly and the Family Stone, has died at 82. These five songs show the power of his influence.

title.children: These 5 songs show how Sly Stone changed music forever

image.altText: A woman in a lab coat holds a blood sample in a laboratory.

props.synopsis: Patients have to eat gluten for weeks before the current coeliac disease test, even when it makes them ill, but Australian researchers believe they have found a better method.

title.children: 'Life-changing' test developed for people allergic to gluten
